column1: (e)  if the petitioner has no reason to suppose that his application will

15 SC/APPEAL/137/2019: be opposed by any person, he can file with his petition an affidavit
to  that  effect  and  omit  to  name  any  person  in  his  petition  as
in the case of an application for probate, if no respondent is named
in  the  petition,  the  court  may  in  its  discretion  make  the  order
absolute in the first instance – section 529(1)
